main event: An unidentified object was observed in the sky near Klamath, California on November 20, 1962.
interesting points: The object was described as a 'star' that was much brighter than the background stars, with a rotating beacon-like light on it.
The object was observed by 8 witnesses and was seen for about 55 seconds.
The flight path of the object was described as erratic, appearing to hover at times.
Ground radar tracked the object, which was estimated to be traveling at a high speed, possibly Mach 2.
The object was observed between 22:22 and 22:45 local time, with the sighting lasting approximately 25 minutes.
sighted object: A bright, white object with a rotating beacon-like light
